intro: Tovomita calophyllophylla, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its dense, spherical clusters of white flowers that resemble snowballs, blooming in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a leathery texture with a distinctive aromatic scent. Tovomita calophyllophylla is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking floral display and adaptability to various soil types.
